text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSAllergyIntolerance

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSAllergyIntolerance 0..*EHDSDataSetAllergy intolerance model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
agentOrAllergen 1..1CodeableConceptA specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.24 eHDSIActiveIngredient (ATC, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.61 eHDSISubstance (EMA SMS, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.19 eHDSIAllergenNoDrug (SCT, used in MH@EU); ICD-11 Allergens
typeOfPropensity 0..1CodeableConceptThis element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.18 eHDSIAdverseEventType (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-type (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)
description 0..1stringTextual description of the allergy or intolerance
criticality 0..1CodeableConceptEstimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.57 eHDSICriticality (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-criticality (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)
certainty 0..1CodeableConceptAssertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.58 eHDSIAllergyCertainty (HL7, used in MH@EU) ; http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-verification (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)
status 0..1CodeableConceptCurrent status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.59 eHDSIAllergyStatus (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-clinical (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)
onsetDate 0..1dateTimeWhen allergy or intolerance was identified
endDate 0..1dateTimeDate of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
reaction 0..*BaseAdverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance.
manifestation 0..*CodeableConceptDescription of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.5 eHDSIIllnessandDisorder (ICD-10, alternative in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.11 eHDSIReactionAllergy (SCT, alternative in MH@EU); ICD-11 MMS
date 0..1dateTimeDate and time of allergy manifestation
severity 0..1CodeableConceptSeverity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.13 eHDSISeverity (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/reaction-event-severity (HL7, Required in HL7 FHIR)
onsetDate 0..1dateTimeDate of the observation of the reaction

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSAllergyIntolerance
title: Allergy intolerance model
description: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

element.short: Allergy intolerance model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Patient/subject information
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object
element.definition: Business identifier for the object

element.short: Resource authoring details
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).

element.short: Status of the resource or document
element.definition: Status of the resource or document

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.
element.definition: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.24 **eHDSIActiveIngredient** (ATC, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.61 eHDSISubstance (EMA SMS, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.19 eHDSIAllergenNoDrug (SCT, used in MH@EU); ICD-11 Allergens

element.short: This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)
element.definition: This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU

element.short: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
element.definition: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

element.short: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.
element.definition: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.57 eHDSICriticality (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-criticality (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition
element.definition: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.58 eHDSIAllergyCertainty (HL7, used in MH@EU) ; http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-verification (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.
element.definition: Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.59 eHDSIAllergyStatus (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergyintolerance-clinical (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

element.short: When allergy or intolerance was identified
element.definition: When allergy or intolerance was identified
element.requirements: MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

element.short: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
element.definition: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
element.requirements: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

element.short: Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance.
element.definition: Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance.
element.requirements: ISO IPS (explicit), implicitly in eHN PS Guideline, MH@EU

element.short: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
element.definition: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).
element.requirements: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL. Cardinality in MyHealth@EU for this element, used here, is one manifestation per severity and onset, while the cardinality in FHIR IPS IG allows multiple manifestations per severity and onset.

binding.description: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.5 eHDSIIllnessandDisorder (ICD-10, alternative in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.11 eHDSIReactionAllergy (SCT, alternative in MH@EU); ICD-11 MMS
